pr_title: added String to char[] converter and test

timeline.bodyText: The test should be injecting the conversion service and using that API to verify the conversion takes place
timeline.author: jameskleeh
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,20 @@
+package io.micronaut.context.converters
+
+import spock.lang.Specification
+
+class StringToCharArraySpec extends Specification {
+
+	def "test convert"() {

timeline.bodyText: I don't believe this is working as intended because beans cannot be defined in the inject module since that needs to be compiled first. Also see @jameskleeh comment
timeline.author: graemerocher

timeline.bodyText: Instead of a bean just for this one converter please add this to one of the existing TypeConverterRegistrar beans
timeline.author: graemerocher

timeline.bodyText: My test is failing... can you explain what I am doing wrong?
timeline.author: ladybug
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -42,6 +42,7 @@ class DefaultConversionServiceSpec extends Specification {
         10                      | Float       | 10.0f
         10                      | String      | "10"
         "1,2"                   | int[]       | [1, 2] as int[]
+        "str"                   | char[]      | ['s', 't', 'r'] as char[]

replies.bodyText: The implementation isn't correct. The implementation you had before moving the converter is what it should be
replies.author: jameskleeh
